metadata.title: CVE-2022-37436 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Prior to Apache HTTP Server 2.4.55, a malicious backend can cause theresponse headers to be truncated early, resulting in some headers beingincorporated into the response body. If the later headers have any securitypurpose, they will not be interpreted by the client.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
